channel.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
channel.description:
Finally A CURE FOR CANCER! Source: http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20070511/hl_afp/healthdrugscanceraustralia Another article with some more information: http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/health/6646581.stm News Article:
SYDNEY (AFP) - Australian scientists said Friday they have developed a cancer treatment which could deliver lethal doses of drugs to tumours without the usual harmful side-effects such as nausea and hair loss. Research scientist Jennifer MacDiarmid said the cutting-edge technique uses nanotechnology to create particles which directly attack cancer cells with a "lethal payload" of drugs, without flooding the body with toxic chemicals. Treatments such as chemotherapy typically involve subjecting the patient's entire body to the powerful drugs in order to kill the cancer, causing debilitating side-effects that the new, targeted technique would eliminate. "Your hair wouldn't fall out, you wouldn't throw up... some chemotherapy is life-threatening in itself," MacDiarmid told AFP. MacDiarmid said scientists at Sydney-based biotechnology company EnGeneIC, where she is a managing director, used a bacteria cell stripped of reproductive powers to develop a particle capable of carrying any chemotherapy drug. The nano-cell, which is about one-fifth the size of a normal cell, is then tagged with antibodies which are attracted to cancerous tumours. Once the cell hits the cancer, the drug is released directly into the malignant growth. "There is no other system where you can get so much drug concentrated into a little parcel," MacDiarmid said. The results of animal trials published this week in the US-based journal Cancer Cell show that the technique has reduced tumours in animals without toxic side-effects and by using only a very small amount of drugs. MacDiarmid said the treatment could potentially be used on any solid tumours including those in the breasts, ovaries, colon and lungs. In future, the treatment could allow for the creation of customised drug "cocktails" to be used on patients to counter drug resistance and could lower costs as a smaller amount of drugs would be needed, she said. The team hopes to start human trials by the end of this year.
This is so awesome. This technique could also be used to kill any number of other diseases like AIDS. :D I love nano technology and Australian Scientists. Finally someone doing something good in the world unlike a certain administration. :rolleyes: Any way, this could be the enormous medical break through that may go beyond curing cancer. ~Ron

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

There has been a homeopathic cure for cancer that was worked for YEARS, and has worked every time it has been applied.
It is called Anvirzel.
Anvirzel is a botanical drug derived from the plant Nerium Oleander. A water-soluble extract from Nerium Oleander was pioneered and patented by Dr. Huseyin Ziya Ozel, a Turkish physician who began to experiment with these extracts in 1966.
The reason no one knows about it and it is not used is because the government does not allow it to be FDA approved, and wants to continue to make money.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @seifer225 seifer225
item.description:
@seifer225 wrote:

Hiaburi:

meh i heard there was a cure for cancer found years back, it was a chemical in a tree or sumthing in some forest, but when they went back, the tree had been logged.

Damn them auto woodcutters! Plus ^^ (2 posts above) CONSPIRACY! Dont spread such crap.
Anyways personally Ive lost 2 family members and a cat (It was a cool cat dont laugh =( ), I don’t know if a cure will eventuall be found. The only problem with treatment at the moment is that a tumor is basically a grop of mutated cells, radioactive rays (Gamma rays) can be used to kill cells, but you run the risk of mutating more cells resulting in the cancer spreading to other parts of the body. If only there was a way to kill a group of cells without using radiation (which is unlikely without removing them) =(

Read full topic

Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!

Source:
http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20070511/hl_afp/healthdrugscanceraustralia

Another article with some more information:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/health/6646581.stm

News Article:

SYDNEY (AFP) - Australian scientists said Friday they have developed a cancer treatment which could deliver lethal doses of drugs to tumours without the usual harmful side-effects such as nausea and hair loss.

Research scientist Jennifer MacDiarmid said the cutting-edge technique uses nanotechnology to create particles which directly attack cancer cells with a “lethal payload” of drugs, without flooding the body with toxic chemicals.

Treatments such as chemotherapy typically involve subjecting the patient’s entire body to the powerful drugs in order to kill the cancer, causing debilitating side-effects that the new, targeted technique would eliminate.

“Your hair wouldn’t fall out, you wouldn’t throw up… some chemotherapy is life-threatening in itself,” MacDiarmid told AFP.

MacDiarmid said scientists at Sydney-based biotechnology company EnGeneIC, where she is a managing director, used a bacteria cell stripped of reproductive powers to develop a particle capable of carrying any chemotherapy drug.

The nano-cell, which is about one-fifth the size of a normal cell, is then tagged with antibodies which are attracted to cancerous tumours. Once the cell hits the cancer, the drug is released directly into the malignant growth.

“There is no other system where you can get so much drug concentrated into a little parcel,” MacDiarmid said.

The results of animal trials published this week in the US-based journal Cancer Cell show that the technique has reduced tumours in animals without toxic side-effects and by using only a very small amount of drugs.

MacDiarmid said the treatment could potentially be used on any solid tumours including those in the breasts, ovaries, colon and lungs.

In future, the treatment could allow for the creation of customised drug “cocktails” to be used on patients to counter drug resistance and could lower costs as a smaller amount of drugs would be needed, she said.

The team hopes to start human trials by the end of this year.

This is so awesome. This technique could also be used to kill any number of other diseases like AIDS. I love nano technology and Australian Scientists. Finally someone doing something good in the world unlike a certain administration. :rolleyes: Any way, this could be the enormous medical break through that may go beyond curing cancer.

~Ron
[/quote]

They’ve had cures for cancer since the late 1800s but the government killed all the research because they make so much money off of “find the cure for cancer.”[/quote]
Yeh, it’s like natural herbs and shit but the FDA made it so that they can’t license it without paying a shit load.

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

leader:

What we really need it a vaccine… so we don’t have to get cancer in the first place.

Considerable research effort is now devoted to the development of vaccines (to prevent infection by oncogenic infectious agents, as well as to mount an immune response against cancer-specific epitopes) and to potential venues for gene therapy for individuals with genetic mutations or polymorphisms that put them at high risk of cancer.

As of October 2005, researchers found that an experimental vaccine for HPV types 16 and 18 was 100% successful at preventing infection with these types of HPV and, thus, are able to prevent the majority of cervical cancer cases. This vaccine (Gardasil) was approved by the FDA in June 2006.

This vaccine is only for cervical cancer and not for tumorous cancers.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“juju, post:18, topic:93542”][quote author=Ron link=topic=135696.msg1315503#msg1315503 date=1179107062]
Thanks for all the nice comments. There is a very high chance that this will be the cure for cancer so spread the word about this news and try to donate more money to cancer foundations. :)[/quote]

How many times has that been said before?

Anyway, why on earth would a company even “want” to cure cancer, it’ll mean a major decline in profits/donations for ‘cancer study’. I mean, even if they charge large amounts of money for this treatment and it works, it’ll still be nothing compared to how much they’d make from ‘donations’. It’s just not in their best interests.[/quote]

Why do you think all of these other cures for diseases etc were flops? It’s a conspiracy man…

Read full topic

well, first, I want proof, not just an article about something I want to see it in “action” and actually have a documentary on a person with cancer, also, what If the cancer is too small to be noticeable during CAT scans, and that area isn’t injected with this new find? it will spread and eventually come back or be in a worse place. Or, what if It was sent to a totally different place?

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:9, topic:93542”]Isn’t it “touch wood” not… “knock on wood”?

Also this is cool but its hardly a “cure” its just a different method that eliminates/decreases bad side effects.

What we really need it a vaccine… so we don’t have to get cancer in the first place.[/quote]
It’s both, just look here.

World Wide Words

World Wide Words: Touch wood/knock on wood

A questioner asks about the origins of 'touch wood' and 'knock on wood'.

And goatee, this doesn’t just eliminate side effects. It does in fact cure cancer and prevents the awful side effects of other methods like chemotherapy. A vaccine is nice, but a cure is a start.

Thanks for all the nice comments. There is a very high chance that this will be the cure for cancer so spread the word about this news and try to donate more money to cancer foundations.

[quote=“Doc. Booty, post:14, topic:93542”]Nice find Ron.

See, Us Australians arnt just kangaroos and koalas.[/quote]
Lol. Don’t forget Crocodile Dundees.

Read full topic

item.title: Finally A CURE FOR CANCER!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:6, topic:93542”][quote author=leader link=topic=135696.msg1308252#msg1308252 date=1179022613]
This is great! However, we don’t know if it is successful in curing cancer patients.

The team hopes to start human trials by the end of this year.

[/quote]
Yeah but they test on mice which hare mammals like us. If it works for them, there is a very high chance (99%) of it working for us. Let’s knock on wood that we’re not in the 1% that it won’t work on. ;)[/quote]

Isn’t it “touch wood” not… “knock on wood”?

Also this is cool but its hardly a “cure” its just a different method that eliminates/decreases bad side effects.

What we really need it a vaccine… so we don’t have to get cancer in the first place.
